I checked out this book at Borders today.  It looks good.  I am going to
recommend to the QA team and engineers at Macromedia.

I'm pretty well beyond the book's coverage on JUnit and Ant, so those
sections weren't of interest to me, but what was interesting was the
coverage of JMeter, JUnitPerf, HttpUnit, and Cactus.  Sometimes it will be
much faster for folks to use a book like this to get up to speed on those
tools than if they were left to figure them our for themselves (which many
will never bother to even try).

The best thing about it just from browsing it for a few minutes was that I
learned that JMeter has grown up quite a bit since I last checked it out
over a year ago.

Scott Stirling
JRun QA
Macromedia

From: Nicholas Lesiecki

Gosh, this is the second time I've made a post to a mailing list and
forgotten to include some important detail! That's it, I'm putting a
blurb in my sig file. Anyway, the book is titled:
 
Java Tools for Extreme Programming: Mastering Open Source Tools,
including Ant, JUnit, and Cactus
 
and you can buy it at:
